Description: Round-topped limestone stela divided into four registers: 1 - Two jackals on plinths. 2 - Seven rows of Hieroglyphic text. 3 - Seated male and female figures sniffing lotuses on either side of a loaded table; four columns of Hieroglyphic text to the right. 4 - Three kneeling figures sniffing lotuses; row of Hieroglyphic text above.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1912 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc., in the British Museum, Part 3. (pl.16)
